intro: Adenocarpus aureus subsp. gibbsianus, commonly known as the golden burr, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and distinctive seed pods. The plant typically grows in grasslands and shrublands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, and the flowers are clustered in racemes. The subspecies gibbsianus is distinguished by its more robust growth and slightly larger flowers compared to the typical form.
